FuncDef:
The vlan command creates a VLAN and displays the VLAN view. If the VLAN already exists, the VLAN view is displayed.
The undo vlan command deletes the VLAN. The vlan command creates a VLAN and displays the VLAN view. If the VLAN already exists, the VLAN view is displayed. The undo vlan command deletes the VLAN. By default, VLAN 1 exists.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VLAN ID.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1023.

ExtraInfo: To reduce broadcast domains and enhance security on a complex network, VLANs can be created on the network to isolate the devices that do not need to communicate with each other.
